intro: Epilobium ulleungensis, commonly known as Ulleung Island willow, is a flowering plant native to the Korean island of Ulleungdo. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found near streams or in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
